JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Ambitious Space Company is looking for an experienced RF Engineer.
As an RF Engineer at GomSpace, you will develop, maintain and integrate RF hardware into satellites. The communications systems span a variety of frequency bands starting at VHF, includes S- and X-band, and currently tops out at >30 GHz Ka-band products.

For development you will perform analysis, design, implementation, optimization and enhancement of spacecraft RF systems for our CubeSats. For delivering satellites to customers, you will select RF solution and RF components, support configuration, testing, and troubleshooting of spacecrafts in lab and in orbit, at customers and for customers.

The Job Includes the Following Set of Tasks:

  • Guidance of the design choices from first idea of an RF architecture to a verified product.
  • Customer engagement, discuss requirements and agree solutions with customers
  • Interface with the Systems Engineering team to define architecture and spacecraft design based on required spacecraft attitude determination and control system performance.
  • Satellite link budgets analysis for ground and inter-satellite links.
  • Design of RF systems and circuits for high bandwidth satellite communications system.
  • RF HW block design. Selecting the right approach.
  • Specify, evaluate, and select spacecraft RF components.
  • Hands-on implementation of RF circuits, including block diagrams, schematics capture, PCB layout, and laboratory work.
  • Help project managers and bid managers scope development work packages.
  • Participate in the evolution of GomSpace spacecraft RF architecture including components and systems that provide high pointing performance solution. Develop and maintain technical reference documentation for GomSpace spacecraft RF architecture definition, design, and development.

We expect the Employee to Have the Following Qualifications:

  • Hold a relevant engineering education on a bachelor’s or master’s level, however other backgrounds may apply if you have the right experience.
  • Have at least 3 years of experience with RF system design.
  • Familiar with work in Linux environments.
  • Possess a strong personal drive, commitment, and sense of ownership
  • Work with an iterative and goal-oriented development mindset
  • Take pride in the quality of your work and cannot wait to see your product being launched into space
  • Are a team player who makes the team achieve its’ goals.
  • Able to work independently and in a team environment.
  • Experience in customer facing and explaining complicated technologies in easy understandable terms.
  • Fluent in English on a professional level

GomSpace offers employment in a dynamic growing and internationally oriented company with many challenging and exciting activities. We are an agenda-setting player in the nanosatellite business and expect our employees to contribute with dedication, skills and the will to implement our mission. We are ambitious and believe that nanosatellites and our efforts will make a difference to society in the future. We have an informal working culture with transparent communication and an organisation built up by multidisciplinary skills and engineering passion which we believe are essential to help our customers achieve their goals in space.

Sign Up for Our Mission:

Please send your application in English. Interviews will be conducted on a continuous basis.

Workplace will be in our premises at Langagervej 6, Aalborg, Denmark. Salary and start date will be individually negotiated.

We kindly draw your attention to the fact that we do not receive applications and resumes via e-mail or by personal appearance. This is to protect and show consideration for your personal information. Apply for the job by following the link below.

About GomSpace | GomSpace is a globally leading designer, integrator and manufacturer of high-end nanosatellites for customers in the academic, government and commercial markets. Our positions of strength include systems integration, nanosatellite subsystems and advanced miniaturised radio technology. Our international team is devoted to understanding our customer’s requirements and deliver flawlessly. We are listed in Stockholm (GOMX), headquartered in Denmark and have subsidiaries in Sweden, Singapore, North America and Luxembourg. We are more than 200 employees servicing customers in more than 55 countries. Learn more on www.gomspace.com
